translation.en: Hello, my name is Detective Gil Carrillo,
Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department, assigned to Homicide Bureau.
The Sheriff's Department is conducting an investigation…
on a series of homicides and sexual assaults occurred in Los Angeles County.
translation.ko: 일련의 살인과 성폭행 사건들을 수사하고 있습니다

translation.en: The suspect, who has traveled highways in what we believe to be stolen vehicles,
translation.ko: 용의자는 도난 차량을 몰고 고속도로로 다니는 것으로 보이며

translation.en: is always wearing gloves to make his entries.
translation.ko: 주택에 침입할 때 항상 장갑을 착용합니다

translation.en: The suspect has used
[echoing] guns, knives, tire irons, handcuffs and thumbcuffs,
translation.ko: 총, 칼, 타이어 레버, 수갑에 엄지 수갑은 물론

translation.en: as well as his own foot, to inflict serious…
Los Angeles City has almost all benefits
and no negatives.
[woman 1] This was a decade when the queen visited, the Pope visited.
We had the Olympics.
We were proud of the city, proud of LA.
For the first time in recorded history, our freeways were relatively clear.
-[woman 1] It was a huge decade. -Crime dropped like a rock.
[reporter] Our top story,
record temperatures and fires scorching the Southland.
translation.ko: 남부 지역에 기록적인 폭염과 화재가 발생했습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] Downtown the mercury reached 107 degrees this afternoon.
translation.ko: 네, 오늘 오후 도심 수은주가 41.7도에 이르렀습니다

translation.en: [woman 1] You have this amazing city, so many parallel universes.
translation.ko: 이 놀라운 도시에는 수많은 평행 우주가 있어요

translation.en: [woman 2] LA was a facade.
From one side, it was glamorous celebrities.
But if you went around to the other side…
…LA could be a very dark place.
[woman 2] You could be anybody.
It also attracted very, very dangerous people.
Nobody knows where this individual may strike next.
translation.ko: 범인이 다음에는 어디를 노릴지 아무도 모릅니다 "셔먼 블록 LA 카운티 보안관"

translation.en: [reporter 3] The same man is suspected in six to eight murders and 25 to 30 attacks.
There's sort of a thin line between
translation.ko: 피해망상을 갖는 것과 위험을 인식하는 것은

translation.en: being paranoid about it and being aware of it.
translation.ko: 피해망상을 갖는 것과 위험을 인식하는 것은 종이 한 장 차이죠

translation.en: …the so-called Night Stalker who has terrorized California.
translation.ko: 이른바 '나이트 스토커'가 캘리포니아를 공포에 떨게 합니다

translation.en: He struck again.
People wonder when and where he'll strike next.
Everybody is scared.
I am not leaving my door open for my son, I don't care if he sleeps on the street.
translation.ko: 아들내미야 길에서 자든 말든 저는 문 꼭 잠그고 자요

translation.en: [woman] I don't understand why somebody can't identify him.
translation.ko: 왜 못 찾는지 이해가 안 돼요

translation.en: He has to live somewhere. Somebody must know.
He's a weird-looking character. Somebody has to know him.
translation.ko: 이상해 보이는 인간이니 아는 사람이 있을 거 아니에요

translation.en: [Gil] I don't believe that anybody has a choice.
translation.ko: 누구나 선택할 수 있다고 생각하진 않아요

translation.en: Your number is there one day. We're all going to die.
translation.ko: 언젠가 때가 되면 우리는 모두 죽습니다

translation.en: We just don't know when.
You start dying the day you were born.
I was born and raised in the Catholic Church.
translation.ko: 저는 가톨릭 신앙 속에 나고 자랐습니다

translation.en: I believe in God. I believe in the Holy Spirit.
I believe there's a devil. I believe there's an evil force.
translation.ko: 악마가 있고 사악한 힘이 있다고 믿습니다

translation.en: I just say prayers, hopefully to help give me the wisdom and the knowledge
translation.ko: 부디 제게 이 사건을 해결할 지혜와 지식을 주시기만을

translation.en: to bring this case to a solution.
All the people on the block that I lived on, were Mexicans.
translation.ko: 제가 살던 블록에는 멕시코인들밖에 안 살았어요

translation.en: There was a gang where I lived.
We all hung out on the corner of Dulin and Holbrook.
translation.ko: 둘린 홀브룩 교차로에서 다 같이 어울렸어요

translation.en: They were more important than school was to me,
and I didn't realize that until a cop
told my mom and dad, "Sign for this young man to get off the street,
translation.ko: 한 경찰이 부모님께 말했거든요 '아들 군대 안 보냈다간'

translation.en: or he'll end up dead or in prison."
And, so, at age 17, my parents signed for me to go into the Army.
I was a crew chief with 189th Assault Helicopter Company in Vietnam.
translation.ko: 저는 베트남에서 제189 공격헬기 중대 기장이었어요

translation.en: I saw heavy, heavy combat.
By the grace of God, I made it out alive, and…
as soon as I got out of Armed Forces, I had three goals in life.
One was to start dating my former girlfriend,
translation.ko: 하나는 베트남 복무 중에 저를 찬

translation.en: who had dumped me while I was in Vietnam.
I wanted to see if I could get her back, then break up with her.
translation.ko: 마음을 빼앗고 찰 수 있을지 확인하고 싶었어요

translation.en: I wanted revenge, I wanted to hurt her like she had hurt me.
translation.ko: 복수하고 싶었죠 받은 상처를 돌려주고 싶었어요

translation.en: But it didn't work out that way. [laughs]
[Pearl] He got out of the service in June,
and we were married by December.
[Gil] December 26, 1970.
That was goal number one. Goal number two was to go to college.
translation.ko: 그게 첫 번째 목표였고 두 번째는 대학에 가는 거였죠

translation.en: Nobody in my family had ever gone to college,
translation.ko: 우리 가족 중에는 대학 나온 사람이 없었고

translation.en: and I thought college was for rich white people.
translation.ko: 저는 돈 많은 백인들이나 대학 다니는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: So, I enrolled at Rio Hondo College…
and started going there.
Two out of three goals I accomplished.
And the third one was I wanted to become a cop.
translation.ko: 세 번째 목표는 경찰이 되는 거였습니다

translation.en: October 1st, 1971…
I became a patrol cop at East LA Sheriff's Station.
When I was 29 years of age, I got an outstanding evaluation.
Those were hard to come by.
When I showed it to my mom and dad, my dad looked up and said…
translation.ko: 부모님께 보여드렸더니 아버지가 저를 보고 말씀하셨어요

translation.en: "I'm proud of you, son."
And he had never said that to me in my life.
translation.ko: 아버지께 그런 말을 들은 건 제 평생 처음이었어요

translation.en: He always wanted to make his dad proud.
translation.ko: 남편은 언제나 아버님의 자랑이고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: Proud of him.
[Gil] After that, I watched guys from homicide work.
They were so meticulous, so good.
When they pulled up on the scene, everybody got out of their way.
translation.ko: 그들이 현장에 나타나면 다들 길을 비켜줬죠

translation.en: "Wow, sheriff's homicide's here."
I told them, "One of these days, I want to do your job."
translation.ko: 언젠가 저도 살인수사과에서 일하고 싶다고 말했어요

translation.en: March 23rd, 1981…
I get called to go to Homicide Bureau.
I only had nine and a half years experience.
That was my goal, that was my dream, and… I made it.
The Bulldogs. That was their nickname.
I covered hundreds of crimes and dozens and dozens of murders…
translation.ko: 저는 수백 건의 범죄와 수십 건의 살인을 보도했는데요

translation.en: In downtown Los Angeles, Tony Valdez… [echoing] …Channel 11 News.
translation.ko: 로스앤젤레스 도심에서 채널 11 뉴스 토니 발데스입니다

translation.en: …and I can tell you there were a lot of murders that ended up being solved
translation.ko: "토니 발데스 KTTV 뉴스 기자" 수많은 살인 사건이 20년이 지난 후에

translation.en: 20 years later, because the Bulldogs never let go.
translation.ko: 결국은 해결되곤 했습니다 불도그들은 물면 안 놓거든요

translation.en: [Frank] We probably ran 350, 400 murders a year
translation.ko: "프랭크 살레르노 형사 LA 카운티 보안관국 살인수사과" 보안관국 살인수사과에서 저희가 수사한 살인 사건이

translation.en: for the sheriff's homicide bureau.
Los Angeles Police Department was probably running 500 or 600.
So, in LA County, there's probably close to 1,000 murders a year.
translation.ko: 그러니까 LA 카운티에서 매년 1,000건 가까이 발생한 거죠

translation.en: And it takes a big ego, because you got to have confidence in what you're doing.
translation.ko: 그리고 큰 자부심이 필요합니다 많은 확신이 필요한 일이거든요

translation.en: You're investigating the ultimate crime.
There's nothing more serious than one human being taking the life of another.
translation.ko: 남의 생명을 빼앗는 것보다 더 심각한 범죄는 없습니다

translation.en: [Gil] Frank Salerno's the Italian Stallion, he's the goombah, he's…
he's everything.
When I got there, he was working on the Hillside Strangler.
translation.ko: 제가 갔을 때 프랭크는 힐사이드 교살자 수사 중이었어요

translation.en: [reporter] This is where the first Hillside Strangler victim was found.
translation.ko: 힐사이드 교살자의 첫 피해자가 발견된 곳입니다

translation.en: The death of Laura Collins and 12 other young women
touched off one of the largest manhunts in Southern California history.
translation.ko: 남부 캘리포니아 사상 최대의 용의자 수색이 시작됐습니다

translation.en: [Gil] Everybody looked up to him. He's the man.
[man] If you saw Frank Salerno or heard his name,
translation.ko: 프랭크 살레르노를 보거나 그 이름이 들리면

translation.en: these were not small-time crimes.
translation.ko: 시시한 사건이 아니었죠 "폴 스콜닉 KNBC 뉴스 프로듀서"

translation.en: They were bringing heavy guns.
Frank Salerno was a straight shooter. He's a disciplined guy.
translation.ko: 프랭크 살레르노는 고지식하고 엄격한 사람이었죠 "로럴 에릭슨 KNBC 뉴스 기자"

translation.en: He was always a poker face.
He's very businesslike.
[reporter] His co-workers call him a cop's detective.
[man] Frank overlooks nothing.
You'd be surprised how thorough he is on an investigation.
translation.ko: 수사에 얼마나 철두철미한지 보면 놀라실 겁니다

translation.en: [Frank] Gil Carrillo and Jim Mercer were teamed together as partners.
translation.ko: 길 카리요와 짐 머서가 파트너로 한 팀이 됐어요

translation.en: He sat at a desk that was behind me and to my left.
translation.ko: 길은 제 뒤편 왼쪽 책상을 썼죠

translation.en: And he was the youngest detective in the Bureau at the time.
translation.ko: 그 당시 살인수사과에서 제일 어린 형사였어요

translation.en: One day, Frank comes over and says,
"Want to go down to Little Joe's?" An Italian restaurant in Chinatown.
And I'm sitting there and I've never eaten Italian food.
translation.ko: 거기 가서 앉았는데 이탈리아 음식은 난생처음이었죠

translation.en: I grew up in a Mexican home. That's what I know, is Mexican food.
translation.ko: 멕시코 가정에서 자랐고 멕시코 음식밖에 몰랐거든요

translation.en: I look at this menu and I don't recognize anything.
translation.ko: 메뉴를 보는데 아는 게 하나도 없었어요

translation.en: I don't know what it is. I remember ordering chicken Parmesan.
translation.ko: 뭐가 뭔지 몰랐죠 치킨 파르메산을 시킨 게 기억나요

translation.en: And I'm eating this food and I'm laughing.
Salerno looked at me, said, "What's so funny, kid?" I said,
translation.ko: 살레르노가 절 보고 물었어요 '뭐가 그리 웃겨?'

translation.en: "Here I am, last week, I'm eating a double-wrapped red chili burrito
translation.ko: '지난주에는 이스트 LA에서 레드 칠리 부리토 더블랩 먹다가'

translation.en: off the hood of a radio car in east LA.
Tonight, I'm wearing a suit and tie,
eating some shit that I don't know what it is, drinking a glass of wine
translation.ko: '뭔지도 모르는 걸 먹고 와인을 마시고 있네요'

translation.en: with Frank Salerno and the guys from Homicide.
It don't get any better than that."
[woman] I was working at AT&T,
and across the street was a mini-mall.
And in there was a Salvation Army store.
And I would just spend my lunch hour in there.
And once, I was in there,
translation.ko: 하루는 가게에 갔더니 테이블 위에 가득한

translation.en: there was a table that was full of junk,
translation.ko: 하루는 가게에 갔더니 테이블 위에 가득한 잡동사니 속에 모자가 있길래

translation.en: and there was this hat.
And I picked it up, 'cause the letters on it said "AC/DC."
I didn't know what that was, and thought it was kind of weird.
And so, I threw it back down.
And then on my right, here comes this man,
translation.ko: 그때 제 오른쪽으로 그 남자가 오더니

translation.en: and he stood right there and picked up the hat…
looked at it…
turned around and looked at me,
and kind of smiled a little bit,
and he had the devil on his hand.
A picture. A round circle with the face of the devil.
translation.ko: 동그란 원에 악마 얼굴이 그려진 그림이었죠

translation.en: You know, with the horns?
And he got the hat, walked away.
When I went home from work,
I was on the freeway with my little car,
and here comes somebody speeding way behind me.
Then all of a sudden, he just swerves around my car.
translation.ko: 그러다 갑자기 제 옆으로 차선을 변경했죠

translation.en: It's like he's right there.
Like a moment, stop.
And he turns and he just… He's looking at me.
I remembered, you know, that was the same guy I saw
translation.ko: 저는 기억이 났죠 구세군 가게에서 봤던

translation.en: at the thrift store.
And he has this horrible big grin and he's missing all these teeth.
translation.ko: 소름 끼치게 크게 웃는데 이가 다 빠져서 없었어요

translation.en: He just stared at me, like a weird smile.
It was like a killer clown.
[Gil] The date was March 17th, 1985, Saint Patrick's Day.
[Gil] I actually got that murder with my partner.
translation.ko: 파트너와 함께 그 살인 사건을 맡았어요

translation.en: I get there and the garage door is open.
translation.ko: 현장에 갔더니 차고 문이 열려 있더군요

translation.en: In the garage,
I see blood spatterings around the door and on the floor,
translation.ko: 문 주변과 바닥 위에 피가 튄 자국이 있었어요

translation.en: right by the door that separates the garage from the condo proper.
There was a baseball cap.
It said "AC/DC" on it.
And I go inside the condo…
walk around…
and see a bloody phone inside the bedroom.
[Gil] And I see Dayle Okazaki lying on the kitchen floor…
translation.ko: 그리고 부엌 바닥에 쓰러져 있는 데일 오카자키를 봤죠

translation.en: wearing a Dodger jersey.
She had been shot right in the forehead.
She'd put her hands on the countertop, and lifted her head up
translation.ko: 조리대에 손을 얹고 머리를 내밀었던 거예요

translation.en: because it was quiet in there, wanted to see where the suspect was at.
translation.ko: 집 안은 조용했고 용의자가 어디 있나 보려 했겠죠

translation.en: He was on the other side of the countertop waiting for her,
translation.ko: 용의자는 조리대 반대편에서 피해자를 기다리고 있었고

translation.en: knowing that she was going to pop her head up, 'cause he could see her hands,
translation.ko: 머리를 내밀 걸 알고 있었죠 손이 보였으니까요

translation.en: waiting there, and when she did, he pulled the trigger.
translation.ko: 기다리다가 머리를 내밀자 방아쇠를 당긴 거예요

translation.en: Maria Hernandez had just driven home.
translation.ko: "마리아 에르난데스 데일의 룸메이트이자 생존자" 마리아 에르난데스는 차를 몰고 집에 도착해 차고로 들어왔죠

translation.en: She entered via the garage door
translation.ko: 마리아 에르난데스는 차를 몰고 집에 도착해 차고로 들어왔죠

translation.en: that she opened with a garage door opener, a remote.
translation.ko: 마리아 에르난데스는 차를 몰고 집에 도착해 차고로 들어왔죠 리모컨으로 문을 열고서요

translation.en: Maria says she keyed the door when she heard an intentional noise.
translation.ko: 마리아는 열쇠를 끼우다가 누가 일부러 내는 소리를 들었대요

translation.en: She turned around and there was a male suspect with a stargazed look,
translation.ko: 몸을 돌리자 멍한 표정의 남자가 있었고

translation.en: with a gun stretched out coming towards her face,
and she put her hands up and he pulled the trigger.
translation.ko: 마리아가 손을 올리자 남자는 방아쇠를 당겼죠

translation.en: The bullet deflected off the keys in her hand.
translation.ko: 총알은 마리아 손의 열쇠에 맞고 튀었어요

translation.en: It knocked her to the ground.
He then pushed her body out of the way, entered the condo.
translation.ko: 남자는 마리아 몸을 밀어내고 콘도로 들어갔어요

translation.en: She jumped up and started running down the alleyway
translation.ko: 마리아는 벌떡 일어나 골목으로 달리기 시작했고

translation.en: when she heard another gunshot.
She became concerned for her roommate,
so she went around the front of the condo
thinking he'll come back out the garage door.
translation.ko: 남자가 차고 문으로 나올 줄 알고요

translation.en: But he didn't.
He came out the front door.
He sees her.
He's just as startled as she is to see him.
translation.ko: 마리아가 놀랐듯이 남자도 마리아를 보고 놀랐죠

translation.en: Maria says, "I just threw my hands up and said,
translation.ko: 마리아는 손을 들고 이렇게 말했다고 해요

translation.en: 'Hey, you already shot me once, do you really have to shoot me again?'"
translation.ko: '이봐요, 벌써 한 번 쏴놓고 정말 또 쏴야겠어요?'

translation.en: At which time, the suspect puts the gun down by his side
and doesn't even run.
He walks away.
[Gil] I'm at the Maria Hernandez house.
translation.ko: 마리아 에르난데스의 집에서 생각한 것은 오로지

translation.en: I'm not thinking about anything else,
translation.ko: 마리아 에르난데스의 집에서 생각한 것은 오로지 제가 관찰한 바에 대해 정확한 기록을 남기는 거였습니다

translation.en: other than getting accurate documentations of what my observations are.
translation.ko: 제가 관찰한 바에 대해 정확한 기록을 남기는 거였습니다

translation.en: So, I'm documenting everything from ambiance to smell,
translation.ko: 그래서 모든 걸 기록했죠 분위기부터 냄새까지

translation.en: using fixed objects to measure where her foot is, where her head is,
translation.ko: 다리와 머리 위치는 어디인지 고정 물체를 이용해 측정하고

translation.en: and…
directing the photographer to take photographs of the crime scene.
And once that's done,
then I can start thinking about motives,
translation.ko: 범행 동기가 뭔지 어떻게 해결할지 비로소 생각해 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: and thinking about solving this case.
translation.ko: 어떻게 해결할지 비로소 생각해 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: I'm inside the living room and the deputy opens a door and says,
translation.ko: 저는 거실에 있었는데 순경이 문을 열고 하는 말이

translation.en: "Excuse me, the mother of Maria Hernandez is out here
and she'd like to have a word with you."
While the door is open, he's standing there, I hear somebody say,
"Gilbert, is that you?"
I'm there saying, "Gilbert? Nobody calls me-- I'm Gil.
translation.ko: 저는 앉아서 대답했죠 '누가 길버트라고 해, 길이지'

translation.en: I'm too cool to be Gilbert."
And I can't see her, I hear her voice.
And she says,
"It's me, Pauline."
And I said, "Pumpkin?"
And she said, "Yes."
And it was the mother of Maria Hernandez.
A neighbor that lived three doors down from me when I was a kid growing up.
translation.ko: 제가 어릴 때 살던 집에서 세 집 건너 살던 이웃이죠

translation.en: This case was already close to home.
translation.ko: 이 사건은 이미 저와 밀접하게 관련돼 있었어요

translation.en: We find out the next day that 40 minutes after the murder of Dayle Okazaki,
translation.ko: 다음 날 알게 됐는데 데일 오카자키 피살 40분 후

translation.en: the Monterey Park Police Department got a call.
There was a murder that had occurred
probably a mile from where Dayle Okazaki got killed.
translation.ko: 몇 km 거리에서 살인 사건이 발생한 겁니다

translation.en: They've got a young Asian girl that is driving down the street,
translation.ko: 젊은 아시아 여성이 차를 몰고 가다가

translation.en: and all of a sudden she is stopped,
and she's yanked out of her car,
and she's shot for no apparent reason.
translation.ko: 뚜렷한 이유도 없이 총에 맞았단 거예요

translation.en: [reporter] Tsai-Lian Yu was left sprawled in the street, shot in the chest.
translation.ko: 차이리안 유는 가슴에 총을 맞고 길에 쓰러진 채 버려졌습니다

translation.en: Her last words:
"Help me! Help me!"
[Gil] It was the same caliber weapon,
but you can't assume that it's the same gun because…
translation.ko: 같은 총일 거라고 추정할 수는 없었어요

translation.en: …there are thousands upon thousands of .22s out there.
Maybe it's not.
So now we have Maria Hernandez in the hospital.
We told her we'd like to send the staff artist. She says, "Sure."
translation.ko: 몽타주 그릴 직원을 보내겠다고 했더니 좋다더군요

translation.en: [Maria] I can tell you he was… 5'10", something like that. Dark clothes…
[Gil] When that staff artist brought me the picture,
translation.ko: - 어두운 옷을 입고... - 직원이 가져온 그림을

translation.en: I was showing it to the detectives over at East LA Station,
and a friend of mine said, "Gil, hold that thought."
He goes out to his car and he brings out an identikit drawing.
translation.ko: 차에 가더니 몽타주 한 장을 가져왔어요

translation.en: You put them together, it looks like the same guy.
His drawing came from the physical description of a suspect
translation.ko: 그 몽타주는 피코리베라 유괴 미수 용의자의

translation.en: of an attempted kidnapping out of the city of Pico Rivera.
My mind started working because,
before I got to Homicide, I was going to Cal State LA.
translation.ko: 제가 살인수사과에 오기 전 캘리포니아주립대를 다녔는데

translation.en: There was a professor by the name of Robert Morneau.
Great man, best professor I've ever had.
translation.ko: 훌륭한 분이시고 제가 아는 최고의 교수시죠

translation.en: And I took Advanced Criminal Investigation Pertaining to Sex Crimes from him.
And I remembered that there's a deviancy that says,
translation.ko: 이런 성적 도착이 있다는 게 기억났어요

translation.en: "I like to see a frightened look on your face."
"I want to see you scared. That's what really gets me turned on."
translation.ko: '무서워하는 게 보고 싶다 그게 정말 흥분된다'

translation.en: That's excitement to them.
With Maria Hernandez,
he could have walked up behind her in silence and killed her.
translation.ko: 조용히 뒤로 다가와 죽일 수도 있었는데

translation.en: He didn't.
He intentionally slapped the top of a car…
-[slapping echoes] -…so she could turn around and see him.
translation.ko: 그래야 마리아가 몸을 돌려 자신을 볼 테니까요

translation.en: Dayle Okazaki,
she was down on the ground and he waited until he saw the fear in her eyes,
translation.ko: 바닥에 쓰러진 채로 겁에 질린 눈빛을 보일 때까지

translation.en: then he shot her right here.
Tsai-Lian Yu,
why wasn't she killed right there in the car?
Whoever the suspect was wanted confrontation. Wanted to see that fear.
translation.ko: 용의자는 대면을 바란 거예요 겁에 질린 걸 보고 싶었던 거죠

translation.en: That's what started me thinking about, perhaps, one man doing this.
translation.ko: 그래서 이런 생각이 들기 시작했어요 '어쩌면 동일범 소행일 수도 있겠다'

translation.en: …with…
And…
[Frank] Ten days after Okazaki, Hernandez, and Yu,
translation.ko: 오카자키, 에르난데스, 유가 공격당한 지 10일 후

translation.en: there is a double murder out in Whittier County area.
translation.ko: 휘티어 카운티에서 이중 살인 사건이 발생합니다

translation.en: [Gil] The house of Vincent and Maxine Zazzara.
JD Smith and Russ Yuloth went to that case. It was their murder.
translation.ko: JD 스미스와 레스큘로프가 그 살인 사건을 맡았습니다

translation.en: It's a pretty brutal murder.
You could see where he stepped on a five-gallon plastic can
and got in the house through an open restroom window.
translation.ko: 열린 화장실 창문을 통해 집에 침입한 것으로 보였어요

translation.en: The place was ransacked.
[Frank] There was a $40,000 theft
that occurred there in jewelry and things.
The male is executed as he's sleeping on the couch…
-[gunshot] -…with a gunshot wound to the temple.
A .22 was used.
[Gil] So now you have Dayle Okazaki killed with a .22,
Tsai-Lian Yu killed with a .22, and the Zazzaras killed with a .22.
translation.ko: 차이리안 유도, 자자라 부부도 22구경으로 살해된 겁니다

translation.en: [Frank] And the woman is found in bed.
[Gil] She has several stab wounds just above the vagina.
translation.ko: 음부 바로 위쪽으로 여러 개의 자상이 있었습니다

translation.en: She had been raped,
and he actually cut her eyes out.
[Frank] Why?
Why did he do that?
Was it because she stared at him or got a hard look at him?
translation.ko: 부인이 자신을 쳐다봐서? 얼굴을 똑똑히 봐서?

translation.en: [Gil] He took the eyes with him, and then he's gone.
translation.ko: 그렇게 도려낸 눈을 갖고 용의자는 사라졌습니다

translation.en: [Frank] The biggest thing in that case was…
translation.ko: 그 사건이 남긴 가장 큰 단서는

translation.en: a shoe print left at the point of entry and in flower beds around the house.
translation.ko: 진입로와 집 주변 화단에 남은 발자국이었어요

translation.en: That was a full-sized 11 to 12 shoe.
[woman] I was six, and my first memory of that night is…
translation.ko: 저는 그때 6살이었고 그날 밤의 첫 기억은...

translation.en: the window opening and being woken up.
And then being ushered out the window,
and being carried.
It kind of hurts me to say that
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하기 가슴 아픈데 친근감이 들었어요

translation.en: there was a familiarity, uh…
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하기 가슴 아픈데 친근감이 들었어요 "아나스타샤 흐로나스 나이트 스토커 생존자"

translation.en: you know, he reminded me of a family member,
translation.ko: 우리 가족 중 한 명을 떠올리게 했거든요

translation.en: and, you know, I was half asleep, I didn't know what was going on.
translation.ko: 그리고 반쯤 잠들어서 무슨 일이 일어나는지 몰랐고

translation.en: So, I thought, "Well, that's okay. I know him,
so… I guess this is okay that I'm going."
I don't know how long I was in the car or what it looked like.
translation.ko: 차를 얼마나 탔는지 어떻게 보였는지는 몰라요

translation.en: But I do remember
there was one point where we were driving,
and… he looked at me and,
translation.ko: 차를 타고 가다 어느 시점에 그 사람이 저를 보고 말했어요

translation.en: he said, you know,
"Open up the glove compartment."
And I did and there was a gun inside.
And he shut it and just kind of like-- "Just so you know, that's there."
translation.ko: 그 사람이 서랍을 닫았어요 알아두라는 듯이

translation.en: Things started from there.
You know…
Look at him and… touch him and things like that.
translation.ko: 그 사람을 보고 만지고 그런 것들요

translation.en: And then we got to where we were going.
I remember there being German Shepherds barking and a chain-link fence.
translation.ko: 저먼 셰퍼드가 짖었고 철책이 있던 게 기억이 나요

translation.en: And he made me get into a zipped-up duffel bag
translation.ko: 지퍼 달린 더플백에 저를 들어가게 했고

translation.en: and he told me, "You need to be quiet.
You need to get in here."
Like, "Don't mess with me.
Do what I say."
We had to walk through a room with a couch,
and everything was dark and kind of dingy.
The windows were covered with drapery or something that made it dark, and…
translation.ko: 두꺼운 커튼인지 뭔지로 창문을 덮어놔서 어두웠고

translation.en: I don't know. Just slimy.
Food packages and…
take-out stuff around.
Very not my house.
There was just this soundtrack of Madonna going on.
[Anastasia] "Holiday" and "Like a Virgin."
All of those songs…
…over and over.
I remember saying, "Stop. This hurts. Don't."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말한 게 기억나요 '그만요, 아파요, 하지 마세요'

translation.en: Or, like, "Why are you doing this?"
You know, I'd say, like, "Can I go to the bathroom?"
He would stop what he was doing, take me to the sink
translation.ko: 그 남자는 하던 짓 멈추고 저를 싱크대로 데려가서

translation.en: and sit me on the sink.
And then nothing would happen for a while, then he'd take me back and… continue.
translation.ko: 한참 볼일을 못 보고 있으면 다시 데려와서 하던 짓을 계속했죠

translation.en: And I would ask again,
"I have to go to the bathroom. Can you please stop?"
translation.ko: 전 또 말했어요 '화장실 가고 싶어요' '그만하면 안 돼요?' 그러면 그 남자는 그만뒀어요

translation.en: And he would keep stopping.
translation.ko: '그만하면 안 돼요?' 그러면 그 남자는 그만뒀어요

translation.en: But, each time, it's like, "All right, I know you don't have to go."
translation.ko: 하지만 화장실은 핑계란 걸 매번 아는 눈치였죠

translation.en: Something in the way that he would look at me that…
translation.ko: 그 남자가 저를 보는 게 꼭...

translation.en: It was almost like, "I'm sorry that I'm doing this to you.
translation.ko: 이런 말 같았어요 '이런 짓을 해서 미안하다'

translation.en: But I'm not sorry, 'cause I'm not going to stop."
He put me in the bag again, to leave the place where we were.
translation.ko: 다시 저를 가방에 넣고 그곳을 떠났어요

translation.en: And after a while we stopped…
on the side of the road,
and he said, "There's a gas station over there.
I want you to go in there and I want you to tell them to call 911
and have them get your family to come get you."
Um, so…
he let me go.
[Frank] At that time there was a series of child abductions,
translation.ko: 그때 아동 유괴 사건들이 잇따라 발생했어요

translation.en: or attempted abductions, of children.
In each case, the child was sexually assaulted.
translation.ko: 각 사건의 피해 아동은 성폭행을 당했습니다

translation.en: [reporter] February 25th, in Montebello,
a six-year-old girl was taken from a schoolyard, molested, then abandoned.
translation.ko: 6세 여아가 운동장에서 유괴되어 성추행당한 뒤 버려졌습니다

translation.en: March 11th in Monterey Park,
a nine-year-old boy was snatched from his bed,
molested, then abandoned.
March 20th, in Glassell Park,
an eight-year-old girl was taken from her bed,
assaulted in a car, then abandoned.
[Gil] If kids get sexually assaulted, get kidnapped, or anything happens to kids,
translation.ko: 성폭행을 당하든 유괴를 당하든 애들한테 무슨 일이 생기면

translation.en: that's an entirely different unit.
I was assigned to the sheriff's Homicide Bureau.
I'm working one murder…
the murder of Dayle Okazaki and the wounding of Maria Hernandez.
translation.ko: 데일 오카자키 피살 사건이자 마리아 에르난데스 피습 사건을요

translation.en: And as part of your investigation, you look for broadcast.
Everything else that's going on around in the area, what's happening.
translation.ko: 그 밖에 또 그 지역에서 무슨 일이 있나 다 찾아보죠

translation.en: The first description I got was from Maria Hernandez.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 인상착의는 마리아 에르난데스가 묘사했어요

translation.en: When you look at the reports that the children gave…
their descriptions were very similar.
They described him as being tall, thin, light-skinned Hispanic or Caucasian,
translation.ko: 키가 크고 마르고 피부가 밝은 히스패닉 또는 백인

translation.en: disheveled hair,
all black clothing, Members Only-type jacket,
brown-stained gap teeth, and a pungent odor.
translation.ko: 갈색으로 물든 벌어진 치아와 코를 찌르는 악취

translation.en: In my opinion, we had a serial killer
translation.ko: 제가 보기에는 연쇄 살인범이었습니다 소년, 소녀, 아동을 유괴하고

translation.en: that was responsible for kidnapping children,
translation.ko: 연쇄 살인범이었습니다 소년, 소녀, 아동을 유괴하고

translation.en: girls, boys, raping adult women, killing adult women, killing males.
translation.ko: 연쇄 살인범이었습니다 소년, 소녀, 아동을 유괴하고 성인 여성을 강간하고 성인 여성, 남성을 죽인 거예요

translation.en: Not many people believed that,
translation.ko: 그렇게 생각하는 사람이 많지 않았던 건

translation.en: because we've never encountered anybody like that…
translation.ko: 그렇게 생각하는 사람이 많지 않았던 건 그런 인간을 본 적이 없었거든요

translation.en: in criminal history.
[Frank] Gil asked me, "What do you think?"
I said, "Is it possible? Absolutely.
Is it probable? Mmm.
It's never been documented before."
[Gil] On April 10th,
I attended a meeting of local law enforcement from the Los Angeles area
translation.ko: 저는 로스앤젤레스 지역 법집행기관 회의에 참석했습니다

translation.en: to exchange information between agencies on the abduction of children.
translation.ko: 아동 유괴 사건의 기관 간 정보 교환을 위해서요

translation.en: I was alleging that the child abductions were related to the homicides.
translation.ko: 저는 그 유괴 사건들이 살인 사건들과 관련이 있다고 주장했어요

translation.en: And they were laughing at me.
[Frank] This just doesn't occur.
You didn't have a guy going around violently killing people
translation.ko: 이런 인간은 없었죠 사람을 끔찍하게 죽이고 다니면서

translation.en: and then also kidnapping and assaulting young people
and allowing them to live.
It's unheard of.
And these old-timers, they laughed it off.
I went there openly and honestly.
I didn't realize that they were going to reject…
and scoff at my theory.
Gil was very frustrated with the way he was being treated.
translation.ko: 길은 자신을 대하는 태도에 크게 좌절했어요

translation.en: [Gil] I had an inside friend that worked Monterey Park that told me,
"Every time you walk out of this office, every time you come in, walk out,
they're motherfucking you to death, thinking you're a young punk
translation.ko: '다 못 잡아먹어 안달이야' '널 자기 이름 날리려는 어린 풋내기로 생각해'

translation.en: trying to make a name for myself."
translation.ko: '널 자기 이름 날리려는 어린 풋내기로 생각해'

translation.en: I thought Gil was right in suggesting that it was one person.
translation.ko: 저는 한 사람의 소행이라는 길의 생각이 옳다고 생각했어요 "린다 아서, LA 카운티 보안관국 범죄 현장 전문가"

translation.en: He had a good sense of this killer.
So, I just encouraged him, as his friend, and said, "Go for it."
translation.ko: 그래서 저는 친구로서 잘해보라고 격려해 줬어요

translation.en: [Gil] I used to use East LA Patrol Station as kind of like my home base.
translation.ko: 저는 이스트 LA 보안관서를 본거지처럼 이용하곤 했어요

translation.en: Deputies there were well aware of what I was working.
translation.ko: 제가 뭘 수사하는지 순경들이 다 알았죠

translation.en: A deputy from the station approached me and said, "Some girls called the cops.
translation.ko: 순경 하나가 와서 하는 말이 '여자 몇 명이 경찰을 불렀어요'

translation.en: They said, "This guy was following us. Here's his plate number.'"
translation.ko: '어떤 남자가 따라오는데 이게 그 차량 번호랍니다'

translation.en: The guy had long hair, was tall, light-skinned Mexican.
translation.ko: 긴 머리에 키가 크고 피부가 밝은 멕시코 남자였어요

translation.en: I got a surveillance team and they're following him
translation.ko: 그래서 감시팀을 붙여 그 남자를 뒤쫓았는데

translation.en: and he went to a restaurant.
And they said he drove around the parking lot
and just kept skulking around, and finally saw a lone female
translation.ko: 어슬렁거리다가 결국 혼자 있는 여자를 보고

translation.en: and he started following her.
She realizes she's being followed, so she splits and she gets away from him.
translation.ko: 그 여자는 누가 따라오자 남자를 따돌렸어요

translation.en: And they're still on him.
They said, "This guy's a freak!"
If he sees any female,
didn't matter, guy went through all kinds of traffic just to get to 'em.
translation.ko: 그저 여자만 보이면 온갖 차를 헤치고 접근했어요

translation.en: And so, we take Arturo Robles into custody…
and I talked to him.
And I said,
"You're making U-turns because you wanna get to a woman?"
translation.ko: '여자 옆에 서려고 계속 유턴을 하는 거냐?'

translation.en: He said, "Yeah, I like women. Nothing wrong with that."
I said, "Lady walks by you, then you ducked down behind the car."
translation.ko: '여자가 지나가면 넌 차 뒤에 숨었잖아' 했더니

translation.en: He says, "Oh, I didn't duck. My shoes were untied."
He had an answer for everything. He was good.
And so I put a six-pack, a mug show folder together.
One of the people I showed it to was Maria Hernandez.
And she said, "That could be him."
And so, we go back, write a search warrant,
translation.ko: 그래서 저희는 돌아가 수색 영장을 발부하고

translation.en: go down to his house,
we find all kinds of pictures out of magazines,
photographs of women.
Wearing a black Members Only jacket, he's got dark clothing.
He's got ladies' underwear, and they're all sliced in the crotch.
translation.ko: 여자 속옷들도 있었는데 전부 가랑이를 잘라냈더군요

translation.en: So, we had a lineup and nobody could pick him in the lineup.
translation.ko: 그래서 줄을 세워봤는데 아무도 아르투로를 지목 못 했어요

translation.en: Not even Maria Hernandez.
My partner looked at me and said,
"He's a freak.
But he's not your freak.
He's not the guy."
[Linda] In the case of the Dois in Monterey Park, I was called to go to their home.
translation.ko: 몬터레이파크 도이 부부 사건 때 그 집으로 호출됐어요

translation.en: So, when I arrived at the scene,
it was really violent…
and destructive.
[reporter] Authorities say that the man shot 66-year-old William Doi,
translation.ko: 당국에 따르면 용의자는 66세 윌리엄 도이를 쏘고

translation.en: then raped, beat and robbed his wife.
Detectives say Doi saved his wife's life by calling 911 before he died.
translation.ko: 도이가 죽기 전 911에 신고함으로써 부인을 살렸다고 형사들은 말했습니다

translation.en: [Tony] They found his wife badly beaten.
On the thumb of her left hand, she was wearing thumbcuffs…
translation.ko: 엄지 수갑을 차고 있던 왼손 엄지손가락이...

translation.en: Eighteen years I worked homicide,
it's the only case I ever came across where thumbcuffs were used.
translation.ko: 엄지 수갑이 쓰인 사건은 이 사건밖에 못 봤습니다

translation.en: [Tony] A bizarre restraining device,
the thumb of her right hand was bleeding profusely,
translation.ko: 부인의 오른손 엄지에서는 피가 철철 흘렀으며

translation.en: indicating that in her attempt to free herself
Mrs. Doi had ripped her thumbs apart.
And that's basically the information we get from the Doi murder.
translation.ko: 도이 피살 사건에서 얻은 정보는 사실상 그게 다였습니다

translation.en: We had…
We had nothing. [chuckles] We had a whodunit.
[Gil] A friend from Montebello PD says,
"I may have found a link that's gonna help you link these cases."
And he showed me a picture of a footprint that was taken at a child abduction.
translation.ko: 아동 유괴 사건 현장에서 찍힌 발자국 사진을 보여줬어요

translation.en: [Frank] She was eight years old and taken from her house,
taken to a construction site and was sexually assaulted,
and then set free.
At that construction site, they had poured concrete that day
and there was a shoe print in the concrete.
And so I went down there. He showed them. I said, "Jesus Christ."
And I recognized it immediately
as the same or similar footprint that was lifted
at the Zazzara homicide crime scene.
[Frank] We knew by Zazzara, we were looking for a pretty good-sized shoe.
translation.ko: 자자라 사건으로 용의자의 신발 사이즈가 크다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: Somewhere between 11 and a 12.
So, I called up my lieutenant and I said, "Okay, I found the link."
And he says, "Gil,
I've got the guys from LAPD in here that are handling that case,
translation.ko: '지금 LA 경찰국에서 그 사건의 수사관들이 왔는데'

translation.en: they're looking for a size ten.
You're looking for a bigger shoe."
I said, "Put them on the phone."
And he got on the phone. I said, "I wanna know how you determine your size,
because I'm looking at a shoe that's a one-to-one with a ruler in it.
It's 12 inches long. How do you get a size 10?"
All they did, because the cement was kind of wet,
was he put his shoe, he wore wingtips,
translation.ko: 신발만 대봤던 겁니다 윙팁을 신고 있었는데

translation.en: size 10,
and he stood on one foot and put his wingtip down over the shoe print,
translation.ko: 한 발로 서서 발자국 위에 윙팁을 대보고

translation.en: and he says, "My shoe covers it. Got to be a size 10."
Says, "I obviously made a mistake, I got to change it.
I got to make it right. You're right."
Now I've got a little bit of circumstantial evidence here.
But that still wasn't enough.
[Frank] In May, 1985,
Gil loses his partner.
My partner goes off, eventually, to retire.
So, we decided to hook up.
Both get a drink at the bar and he says,
"Gil, would you be interested in working with me?"
"Too Cool Carrillo," you know, so I said,
"Yeah, I'll give it some thought."
I went back and sat next to my wife and said,
translation.ko: 저는 집에 돌아와 아내 옆에 앉아 말했죠

translation.en: "Frank Salerno just asked me to be his partner!"
He goes, "Frank Salerno!
He's the best up there!"
[Frank] Gil was young,
enthusiastic,
had a good reputation,
and spoke Spanish,
and I thought we'd make a good team.
[Gil] Next day he comes up to me and he says,"I was in my cups that night."
translation.ko: 다음 날 프랭크가 그러더군요 '어제는 술이 많이 취했어'

translation.en: And I figure… Frank's letting me down easy.
translation.ko: 그래서 프랭크가 좋게 거절하는 줄 알았는데

translation.en: He says, "Yeah, but I'm not in my cups now.
I'm asking you, are you still interested?"
And I said, "Sure."
He says, "Good, I went to the captain. It's gonna happen."
I said, "Cool."
[Frank] Gil and I team up.
We become partners.
I was really surprised, in a way, when I first realized that Frank Salerno,
translation.ko: 어떤 면에서 깜짝 놀랐죠 프랭크 살레르노라고 하면

translation.en: the almost bigger-than-life…
murder cop,
and then,
here's this guy, Gil Carrillo.
I knew him from the streets.
When he was a patrol deputy, he was known as El Cucuy,
the boogeyman.
He was notorious for eating sunflower seeds
and spitting the shells out all over the place.
translation.ko: 껍질을 사방에 뱉고 다닌다고 악명 높았어요

translation.en: Figuring out how he ends up working with Frank Salerno.
translation.ko: 어떻게 프랭크 살레르노랑 일하게 됐는지 의문이었죠

translation.en: They were an odd couple.
Frank was all business, no smiles.
And Gil was this big guy who was, you know, jovial.
Gil was a welcome relief. [laughs]
[Gil] He could've had anybody he wanted as a partner.
And he asked me and I was tickled pink. I was flying.
translation.ko: 저한테 제안해 줘서 정말 기뻤죠 하늘을 나는 듯했어요

translation.en: [reporter] …three-quarters of a million people
to beaches of Southern California to search for a cool--
translation.ko: 남부 캘리포니아 해변으로 75만 명의 인파가 더위를 피해...

translation.en: One hundred degrees every day this week,
and it's expected to stay that way right on through the 4th of July.
No, it's gonna stay hot.
Very hot. Even NBC's Johnny Carson was joking on last night's show about…
translation.ko: 몹시 더울 거예요 NBC의 조니 카슨도 어젯밤에...

translation.en: [Gil] Patty Elaine Higgins was killed in the city of Arcadia.
That's the first case Frank and I had had together.
translation.ko: 프랭크랑 제가 함께 맡은 첫 사건이었죠

translation.en: [Frank] The killer was very enraged.
He viciously cut her throat, then he stabbed her in that slash.
translation.ko: 피해자의 목을 잔인하게 긋고 그은 곳을 찔렀죠

translation.en: Like, you know, here's some more.
That's a very violent individual.
Four days go by…
…and Arcadia PD calls the bureau again, says, "We've got another murder."
translation.ko: "1985년 7월 2일 107일 차" 아케이디아 경찰서는 다시 살인수사과에 연락했죠 '또 살인 사건입니다'

translation.en: So, Gil and I roll out to the Cannon case,
translation.ko: 그래서 길이랑 제가 캐넌 사건을 맡았습니다

translation.en: just a few miles from where Patty Higgins' case was.
translation.ko: 패티 히긴스 사건 현장에서 겨우 몇 km 떨어진 곳이었죠

translation.en: [Gil] She had her throat slit,
very similar to the way Patty Elaine Higgins' throat had been slit
translation.ko: 4일 전 패티 일레인 히긴스가 목이 그인 방식과

translation.en: four days prior.
Then we get to the 5th of July, three days later.
[Frank] We get a call from Sierra Madre PD,
which is not too far from Arcadia right there.
translation.ko: 시에라마드레 경찰서에서 연락이 왔습니다 아케이디아에서 그리 멀지 않은 곳이죠

translation.en: In the front of the house there is a fabric mark and blood…
translation.ko: 집 앞에 가니 직물 자국과 피가

translation.en: on the windowsill,
so we knew that the suspect was wearing,
like, a gardener's glove or something like that.
translation.ko: 정원사 장갑 같은 걸 꼈다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: And we never find a single fingerprint
in any of our crime scenes.
[reporter] She was beaten with a tire iron at her parents' home in Sierra Madre.
translation.ko: 시에라마드레의 부모님 댁에서 타이어 레버로 폭행당했습니다

translation.en: [Frank] The room was ransacked.
I mean, just ransacked.
[reporter] She says she remembers only going to bed.
translation.ko: 잠자리에 든 것만 기억이 난다고 합니다

translation.en: She woke up bloodied, beaten, her bedroom in a disarray.
translation.ko: 피투성이가 되어 깨어난 침실은 어지럽혀져 있었습니다

translation.en: She ended up with 42 inches of lacerations and skull fractures.
translation.ko: 열상 전체 길이가 107cm에 두개골 골절도 있었어요

translation.en: It's a difficult situation to…
stand there and interview a 16-year-old that had just gone through this.
translation.ko: 막 이런 일을 겪은 16살짜리를 거기 서서 면담한다는 게요

translation.en: And you wanna…
You really want to get your hands on that individual.
[Gil] We didn't go in the room where this happened,
translation.ko: 저희는 사건이 일어난 방에 들어가지 않았어요

translation.en: we didn't want to contaminate it.
We're waiting out in the living room when Gisele Lavigne,
who was a criminalist from our crime lab,
she walks out, she's wearing a lab coat, her hair's in a bun, glasses on,
translation.ko: 실험실 가운을 입고 쪽 찐 머리에 안경을 쓰고 걸어 나와서

translation.en: and she says, "Hey, fellas,
found something, may be interesting. You oughta take a look."
She's got a pink comforter in her hand,
and she walks out to us and she opens it up
and there's a shoe print in blood on that comforter.
translation.ko: 피 묻은 발자국이 이불에 남아 있었어요

translation.en: [Gil] And that was the same footprint that was at the Zazzara murder,
translation.ko: 자자라 피살 사건 현장의 발자국과 동일했고

translation.en: and it is the same footprint found at the northeast abduction of a 10-year-old little girl.
translation.ko: 10세 여아 유괴 사건 현장의 발자국과도 동일했죠

translation.en: That's a serial-- There's no doubt in my mind. It's the same guy.
translation.ko: 저는 연쇄 살인이라 확신했어요 동일범 소행이라고요

translation.en: Gil and I just looked at each other.
It's like, "Wow."
The only thing I could say was, "Kiss my ass."
And Frank said, "Yeah, kiss your ass."
It gave me chills, like it's giving me right now.
Right after we saw the footprint,
Frank says, "Okay. Tell me everything you've got in your head."
translation.ko: 프랭크가 말했죠 '자, 머리에 든 거 다 말해봐'

translation.en: Okazaki, Tsai-Lian Yu, Zazzara,
William and Emily Doi.
We have Patty Elaine Higgins, we have Mary Cannon, and now Whitney Bennett.
translation.ko: 패티 일레인 히긴스, 메리 캐넌 휘트니 베넷까지

translation.en: They weren't all my cases,
but I studied them. I knew all the details,
translation.ko: 공부해서 세부 사항을 다 알고 있었죠

translation.en: times, addresses, information, and I told him everything.
translation.ko: 시간, 주소, 정보 전부 프랭크한테 말해줬어요

translation.en: Now it's in black and white in front of you.
There's no denying it.
Gil was right.
The Bureau didn't think it was one man, but once Frank got on board,
translation.ko: 살인수사과에선 동일범으로 보지 않았지만 프랭크가 제 의견에 동의하고 동일범이라고 하자 다들 믿었어요

translation.en: said, "Yes, it's one man," everybody listens.
translation.ko: 프랭크가 제 의견에 동의하고 동일범이라고 하자 다들 믿었어요

translation.en: Picked up the phone called the captain right away.
translation.ko: 프랭크는 전화기를 들고 곧장 과장님께 연락했죠

translation.en: He said, "Okay, let's… let's go at it."
And things started going fast and furious.
We got a hell of a series going here.
We got us a serial killer.
